page.title: 01SHROTON INTRODUCED
page.content: { SHROTON OR IWERNE COURTNEY}IS A SMALL VILLAGE (POP.452) SURROUNDED BY FARMLAND ON THE EDGE OF THE CHALK DOWNS IN NORTH DORSET. IT LIES ON GREENSAND BELOW THE SCARP SLOPE OF THE DOWNS AND THE SPECTACULAR OUTLIER OF HAMBLEDON HILL CROWNED BY ITS HILL FORT. WIDE CLAY LOWLANDS OPEN NORTHWARDS INTO BLACKMORE VALE. THE RIVER IWERNE IS A CLEAR STREAM RUNNING ALONG THE EDGE OF THE VILLAGE AND THROUGH THE PARKLANDS OF TWO LARGE HOUSES, RANSTON AND STEPLETON, WITH THEIR ORNAMENTAL LAKES. THE PEACEFUL VILLAGE LIES OFF THE MAIN ROAD AND IS INHABITED BY PEOPLE WHO HAVE LIVED THERE ALL THEIR LIVES, DORSET FAMILIES AND NEWLY ARRIVED RESIDENTS, OFTEN RETIRED. HOUSES TOO ARE A MIX OF OLD AND NEW. FARMING IS THE MAIN ECONOMIC ACTIVITY WITH ARABLE CROPS, DAIRYING OR SHEEP GRAZING.
